input_text:
Job Title: REMOTE - Clinical Operations - Business Strategy Lead - R7328

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Job Summary

Clinical Operations – Business Strategy Lead serves a subject matter expert and serves as a liaison between internal clinical partners/designees to capture specific business requirements that must be performed by the Clinical Partner or Vendor and serves as a liaison between the Clinical Partner, Organizational Key Stakeholders and Vendors.

Essential Functions

Serve as the strategic partner’s advocate anticipating and resolving problems with the strategic partner. Utilizes partner feedback to determine and recommend best practicesCoordinate between CareSource and clinical partners/vendors to maximize on the relationship and prevent escalations.Develop and maintain expertise in clinical business processes within assigned areas and recommend innovative enterprise level strategies while addressing market specific nuancesWithin assigned areas, develop issue prevention strategies, develop solutions, and participate in negotiating/implementing the chosen course of actionFacilitate or serve on enterprise clinical committees on behalf of the strategic partner to address business process related needsLead cross-functional meetings with stakeholders to guide the development of performance metrics feedback and identify opportunities in assigned projectsParticipate in the development of business cases on behalf of the clinical leads.Assist in the vendor selection process by participating in the RFI/RFP/RFQ process, developing total cost models, and participating in the assessment processAct as a liaison between the clinical leads and vendor throughout the vendor lifecycleParticipate in joint operating committee meetings, and facilitate monthly operational meetings with business owners and delegated/non-delegated vendorsPerform any other job duties as requested

Education And Experience

Bachelor’s degree in business, health administration, health policy or related discipline or equivalent years of relevant work experience is requiredMinimum of three (3) years of experience in managed care clinical programs is preferredPrevious leadership experience is preferredExperience with Medicaid / Medicare or other government programs with highly regulated requirements is preferredWorking knowledge of state, NCQA, and/or URAC requirements preferred

Competencies, Knowledge And Skills

Advanced proficiency level with Microsoft Office Suite including Outlook, Word, Excel and Power PointStrong project management skills with ability to handle multiple projects within time constraintsStrong interpersonal and verbal/written communication skills with demonstrated ability to influence internal/ external constituentsAbility to speak and effectively communicate in front of individuals and groups, vendors, and executive leadershipAbility to interact with all levels of leadership, influence change, adoption of vendor management concepts, and lead cross-functional teams and initiativesAbility to manage complex responsibilities and decisions producing long-range outcomesHighly motivated individual with the ability to work independently in a fast paced environment with changing prioritiesProficient in interpreting business, compliance and regulatory requirements

Licensure And Certification

None

Working Conditions

General office environment; may be required to sit or stand for extended periods of time

Compensation Range

$79,800.00 - $127,600.00 CareSource takes into consideration a combination of a candidate’s education, training, and experience as well as the position’s scope and complexity, the discretion and latitude required for the role, and other external and internal data when establishing a salary level. We are highly invested in every employee’s total well-being and offer a substantial and comprehensive total rewards package.

Compensation Type

Salary

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
